issue.title: [C++] Add option to use dynamic linking with Protobuf libraries
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-2746](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2746). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Currently this is being statically linked. Since some toolchains may use the libprotobuf shared library in other places, we should add an option to allow packagers to utilize a common shared library at link time

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2746?focusedCommentId=16525762) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
Does ARROW-2416 solve this? Or is this different case? (Does this focus on vendored libprotobuf?)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2746?focusedCommentId=16526170) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Yep `[~kou]` you're right, I missed that patch. Closing as duplicate of ARROW-2416.
